thread.title: E-N Game of the Week: (3) Sam Houston vs. (9) Highlands
thread.title_full: E-N Game of the Week: (3) Sam Houston vs. (9) Highlands - San Antonio Express-News

author: Ben Baby
title: E-N Game of the Week: (3) Sam Houston vs. (9) Highlands
text:
Photo: Edward A. Ornelas /San Antonio Express-News Image 1 of / 8 8 Highlands’ Armando Ferguson looks for room around Harlandale’s Ramzey Martinez during first half action Friday Sept. 24, 2015 at Alamo Stadium.
Photo: Edward A. Ornelas /San Antonio Express-News Highlands’ Armando Ferguson looks for room around Harlandale’s... Image 2 of 8 Highlands’ Dylan Camacho heads up field around Harlandale’s Christopher Laque during first half action on Sept. 24, 2015 at Alamo Stadium.
Photo: Edward A. Ornelas /San Antonio Express-News Highlands’ Dylan Camacho heads up field around Harlandale’s... Image 3 of 8 Highlands’ Christopher Mendoza (right) celebrates with teammate Da’Veon Johnson after scoring a two-point conversion during second half action against Harlandale on Sept. 24, 2015 at Alamo Stadium. Highlands won 14-7.
Photo: Edward A. Ornelas /San Antonio Express-News Highlands’ Christopher Mendoza (right) celebrates with teammate... Image 4 of 8 Highlands’ Julian Guerrero tries to shake the tackle of Harlandale’s Robert Palomino during first half actioon on Sept. 24, 2015 at Alamo Stadium.
Photo: Edward A. Ornelas /San Antonio Express-News Highlands’ Julian Guerrero tries to shake the tackle of... Image 5 of 8 Hurricane quarterback Raymonte Prime throws a pass to the left side flat as Brackenridge plays Sam Houston at Alamo Stadium on Oct. 1, 2015.
Photo: Tom Reel /San Antonio Express-News Hurricane quarterback Raymonte Prime throws a pass to the left side... Image 6 of 8 Sam Houston’s Devin Harris celebrates after scoring a touchdown against Southside during second half action on Sept. 4, 2015 at SAISD Complex. Sam Houston won 40-24.
Photo: Edward A. Ornelas /San Antonio Express-News Sam Houston’s Devin Harris celebrates after scoring a touchdown... Image 7 of 8 The Hurricane’s Trenton Jones busts through the middle of the field as Brackenridge plays Sam Houston at Alamo Stadium on Oct. 1, 2015.
Photo: Tom Reel /San Antonio Express-News The Hurricane’s Trenton Jones busts through the middle of the... Image 8 of 8 E-N Game of the Week: (3) Sam Houston vs. (9) Highlands 1 / 8 Back to Gallery Sam Houston vs. Highlands
Kickoff: 7 p.m. Thursday, Alamo Stadium
Radio: Internet only (TSRNSports.com)
E-N Area rankings/records: Sub-6A No. 3 Sam Houston (6-0, 4-0 District 28-5A); Sub-6A No. 9 Highlands (4-1, 3-0 district)
Coaches: Patrick Brown (6-0 at Sam Houston, first season; 31-11 overall, four seasons); Juan Morales (4-1 at Highlands, first year as a head coach)
Series: Sam Houston leads 25-16-2.
Last meeting: Sam Houston won 48-0 in 2014.
Sam Houston breakdown
Setting the scene: The Hurricanes play their second straight Thursday night contest. Sam Houston is coming off a 32-14 victory over Brackenridge to set up a critical district matchup with Highlands. A win over the Owls would not only give Sam Houston the inside track to the 28-5A title, but it could end up deciding playoff seeding.
Key to victory: Unlike last year’s game, the Hurricanes should have more of a problem with the Owls. Sam Houston will need to slow Highlands senior running Armando Ferguson , who is averaging 6.79 yards per carry. Sam Houston will try to keep Highlands senior defensive back Nick Mendoza from padding his team-high total of three interceptions.
Statistical leaders: Passing — Raymonte Prime 88-126-3, 1,723 yards, 26 TDs; rushing — Devin Harris 52-426, 6 TDs; receiving — Jawon Anderson 19-502, 8 TDs.
Highlands breakdown
Setting the scene: One year after a winless season, the Owls have turned it around under first-year coach Juan Morales. Morales, formerly a Brennan assistant, has helped Highlands remain in contention for a district title. After a Week 2 loss to Uvalde, the Owls have won three straight. Highlands topped Lanier 30-14 last week to set up Thursday’s District 28-5A showdown.
Key to victory: Morales’ bunch will have to contain the Hurricanes’ explosive athletes. Sam Houston senior quarterback Raymonte Prime and junior wide receiver Jawon Anderson showed big-play potential last week against Brackenridge. The Hurricanes’ defensive line also pressured Eagles quarterback Antonio Lopez all game, led by sophomore Garland Coleman ’s six sacks.
Statistical leaders: Passing — Dylan Camacho 19-51-4, 378 yards, 7 TDs; rushing — Armando Ferguson 67-455, 5 TDs; receiving — Richard Saldana 11-252, 5 TDs.
E-N prediction
Sam Houston 30, Highlands 26: The Hurricanes could be in for their toughest test during district play and should squeak past the Owls to keep alive the dream of a perfect regular season.
Ben Baby
